activities.name: Golden Gate Bridge
activities.description: Start your day with a visit to the iconic Golden Gate Bridge. Walk or bike across the bridge for stunning views of the bay and city skyline.

activities.name: Fisherman's Wharf
activities.description: Head to Fisherman's Wharf, a bustling waterfront area known for its seafood restaurants, shops, and attractions. Don't miss the sea lions at Pier 39.

activities.name: Alcatraz Island
activities.description: Take a ferry to Alcatraz Island to explore the infamous former prison. Learn about the history of the island and its notorious inmates on a guided tour.

activities.name: Dinner in North Beach
activities.description: End your day with dinner in North Beach, San Francisco's Italian neighborhood. Enjoy a meal at one of the many cozy trattorias or pizzerias.

activities.name: Hiking in Muir Woods
activities.description: Start your day with a hike in Muir Woods National Monument, home to towering redwood trees. Explore the peaceful trails and enjoy the natural beauty of the forest.

activities.name: Stinson Beach
activities.description: After your hike, relax at Stinson Beach, a beautiful sandy beach located just a short drive from Muir Woods. Take a swim, sunbathe, or enjoy a picnic by the ocean.

activities.name: Sausalito
activities.description: Visit the charming town of Sausalito, located across the bay from San Francisco. Explore the shops, art galleries, and waterfront restaurants in this picturesque town.

activities.name: Dinner in the Mission District
activities.description: Head to the Mission District for dinner at one of the many trendy restaurants. Try local favorites like Tartine Bakery or Foreign Cinema for a unique dining experience.

activities.name: Golden Gate Park
activities.description: Start your day at Golden Gate Park, a large urban park with gardens, museums, and attractions. Visit the California Academy of Sciences, the de Young Museum, and the Japanese Tea Garden.

activities.name: Mission Murals
activities.description: Explore the vibrant street art of the Mission District. Take a walking tour to see colorful murals and graffiti art that reflect the neighborhood's history and culture.

activities.name: Chinatown
activities.description: Visit San Francisco's historic Chinatown, the oldest and one of the largest in North America. Explore the colorful streets, shops, and restaurants in this vibrant neighborhood.

activities.name: Dinner in Hayes Valley
activities.description: End your trip with dinner in Hayes Valley, a trendy neighborhood known for its boutiques and restaurants. Consider dining at Rich Table or Souvla for a delicious meal.
